name: Kale and Ricotta Salata Salad
description: This sharp and refreshing salad takes only minutes to put together but is a crowd-pleaser of the first order. This dish would be equally at home at a potluck or as a first course at a dinner party, and no one has to know that you didn’t work for hours on it.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, quick, salads and dressings
recipeIngredient: The juice of a lemon (preferably Meyer), about 2 two tablespoons
1/4 cup of olive oil, or more

recipeInstructions.text: Trim the leaves of the kale above where the stems become thick. (You're going to eat this raw; steam the stems for another use if you like.) Stack the leaves in a pile, roll them like a cigar, and slice it thin crosswise.
Mix together the shallot, lemon juice, salt (go easy on this at first since the cheese is salty), and oil; taste and add more oil if you like.
Toss the dressing with the kale and ricotta salata, taste and adjust seasoning, and serve.
